p: The thermoelectric performance of Ag 1- x InTe 2 before heat treatment as a function of temperature are presented in Fig. 3(a–d), where the Fig. 3a presents the temperature dependence of the Seebeck coefficients ( α). All the α values are positive, indicating that the materials exhibit a p-type semiconductor behavior. At first, the α values for most samples increase as the temperature increases up to ~620 K, and then they rapidly decrease until at 660 K. Above ~660 K the α values increase again as the temperature increases. Such a zigzag-shaped relation is likely attributed to the phase transition in the materials, which will be discussed below.
